node.title: Man missing for three weeks found dead
node.description: A 64-year-old man recently reported missing on the West Coast, has been found dead.

node.title: Fau Vake attack: Man who pleaded guilty to manslaughter jailed
node.description: Daniel Havili, who pleaded guilty to the manslaughter of rising MMA fighter Fau Vake in a late night attack in Auckland has been jailed for two years and nine months.

node.title: Consumer spending trend 'concerning' amid high inflation
node.description: ASB Bank says consumers have been slow to adjust their spending habits to higher inflation, rising interest rates and less government stimulus.

node.title: Medical biotech researchers call for more govt funds
node.description: Medical researchers want government support for biotechnology, which offers life-saving treatments as well as significant economic gains for New Zealand.

node.title: Hundreds more dairy, meat and forestry workers allowed in under new border rules
node.description: The government has announced exceptions allowing 1580 more workers to come to New Zealand for jobs in the dairy, meat processing and forestry industries. Audio

node.title: Russian ambassador continues refusing 'futile' briefings
node.description: Russian Ambassador Georgii Zuev has continued to decline to either appear before select committees, or to be interviewed by media, saying that would be futile.

node.title: CMT Music Awards 2022: Complete list of winners and nominees
node.description: Co-host Kane Brown came into the night with the most nominations of anybody with four.

node.title: Cell tower sales may pay off for consumers
node.description: The possible sale of cellular telecommunications towers by the two biggest network owners could lead to cheaper services for consumers over the longer term.

node.title: Police recover more than $200k of stolen property in Whangārei raid
node.description: Northland police have recovered $200,000 in stolen property after a raid on a Whangārei property.

node.title: Alabama law banning transgender medication challenged in two lawsuits
node.description: The law makes it a crime​ for doctors to treat trans youth under 19 with puberty blockers or hormones to help affirm their gender identity.

node.title: NZTA taking control of NZ's supply of bitumen for roading
node.description: Almost all road building bitumen is being taken over by the Transport Agency, which believes it's being ripped off by suppliers.

node.title: Jury convicts former police officer on 6 counts related to January 6
node.description: Thomas Robertson was found guilty Monday on all charges, including obstructing officers during the Capitol riot.

node.title: Northland local government leadership faces seismic leadership change
node.description: Northland local government is facing its biggest leadership change this year.

node.title: I was raped, then ruined by the systems that were supposed to help me
node.description: She was raped by an ex-boyfriend, then further traumatised by her interactions with colleagues, police and ACC.

node.title: 83-year-old Ukrainian woman says she was raped after Russians took her village
node.description: The woman said she believes her attacker was from Ukraine's far east, a region controlled by Russian-backed separatists.

node.title: One of the highest paid college basketball players talks new sponsorship deals
node.description: Opendorse released data last month that found women basketball players are the second highest paid college athletes.

node.title: Why egg prices are soaring
node.description: Last year, the national average of a dozen large white eggs was $1.60. Now, it's $2.50.

node.title: Police promise 'powerful' response to Auckland central crime spike
node.description: Police are accused of letting criminals run rampant in central Auckland and failing business owners, but say they will return to the area with a 'powerful' presence.

node.title: Defence Force confident 'ageing' Hercules aircraft can cope with Europe deployment
node.description: Commander of Joint Forces Jim Gilmour says he's confident New Zealand's Hercules fleet will be up to the task as 50 Defence Force personnel deploy to Europe. Audio

node.title: Economic sanctions still best way to pressure Russia, Ardern says
node.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says expelling the Russian ambassador remains an option, but it would not have the most impact of the actions New Zealand can take to condemn the Russian invasion. Audio

node.title: Elon Musk will not join Twitter board, says boss
node.description: Elon Musk has decided not to join the board of Twitter, the company's chief executive Parag Agrawal says.

node.title: Pakistan's parliament set to elect new prime minister
node.description: Pakistan's parliament was set to meet on Monday local time to elect a new prime minister, with opposition leader Shehbaz Sharif the favourite to win.

node.title: Surge of support for bar after online trolls' fake reviews
node.description: A Dunedin bar was targeted by online trolls over vaccine certificates. So the bar's co-owner decided to pick up the phone and call them. Audio

node.title: Hot water system theft forces ECE closure
node.description: A Christchurch early learning centre has been forced to close after its hot water system was stolen for the fourth time in the past six months. Audio

node.title: Shanghai residents protest strict COVID lockdown
node.description: At night, between the high rises, a drone warns people to follow COVID rules and tells them not to sing on their balconies.

node.title: U.S. stocks fall, led by slump in tech companies
node.description: Investors look ahead to what company earnings will reveal about impact of inflation​ on profits.

node.title: Woman who falsely accused Black teen of stealing her phone at NYC hotel makes plea deal
node.description: Ponsetto attacked 14-year old Keyon Harrold, Jr. and his father in the lobby of the Arlo Hotel in Manhattan in December 2020, falsely accusing the teen of stealing her iPhone.

node.title: Still recovering from floods, East Coast braces for Cyclone Fili
node.description: Storm-damaged Tairāwhiti and Hawke's Bay are bracing for the onslaught of more heavy rain as Cyclone Fili bears down on the east coast of the North Island. Audio

node.title: California weighs shift to 32-hour work week
node.description: Bill would make it the first state in the nation to adopt a four-day week for some employees.

node.title: Almost two-thirds of Ukraine's 7.5 million children have been displaced
node.description: "In my 31 years as a humanitarian, I have rarely seen so much damage caused in so little time," UNICEF emergency director Manuel Fontaine said.
